texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Trialling an on-demand bus service that operates flexibly in response to local demand"],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
We are running two trials of demand-responsive bus services. We want to find out whether they can:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Complement current public transport services","Reduce car dependency","Offer a service that is accessible and easy to use"]}
The trials are taking place in the London Borough of Sutton and the London Borough of Ealing. Both are running for 12 months.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"How it works"}

Demand-responsive bus services take multiple passengers heading in the same direction and book them into a shared vehicle. The services operate from 'corner to corner', so there are no fixed routes or bus stops.

Instead, the app shows people a clear map of where their virtual bus stop is. They are picked up and dropped off within 200m of their requested destinations. This helps ensure that even with multiple pick-ups, there are no lengthy detours.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The services can be booked by customers aged 13 and over","Journeys can be booked by phone or through the GoSutton or Slide Ealing app available on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/uk/ios/app-store/\"\u003eApp Store \u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://play.google.com/store\"\u003eGoogle Play\u003c/a\u003e ","Oyster cards and contactless are not accepted","Freedom Pass holders and members of the English National Concessionary Travel Scheme can travel free on the service","Buses are wheelchair accessible"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Go Sutton"}
{"template":"image","link":{"image":{}},"image":{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/go-sutton-logo.gif","alt":"Go Sutton logo"},"wrapped":false}
The GoSutton trial service is run in collaboration with ViaVan and Go-Ahead .

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The service operates Monday to Sunday 06:30 to 21:30","Journeys cost between £2 and £3.50 (depending on time of day and journey length)","The trial  runs for 12 months from 28 May 2019"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Area of operation"}

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Demand responsive bus service - area map (dark blue areas indicate an expansion of the service in August 2019)","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/demand-responsive-buses-map-v2.png","icon":"download","size":"PNG 594KB","image":{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/demand-responsive-buses-map-v2-small.png","alt":"demand responsive"}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Slide Ealing"}
{"template":"image","link":{"image":{}},"image":{"url":"https://tfl.gov.uk/cdn/static/cms/images/slide-ealing-logos.jpg","alt":"Slide Ealing logos"},"wrapped":false}
The Slide Ealing trial service is run in collaboration with RATP and MOIA .
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Slide Ealing runs Monday to Sunday 06:00 to 01:00","Journeys cost £3.50","The trial runs for 12 months from 13 November 2019"]}
Slide Ealing covers an area from Southall to the North Circular, and from the A40 to Boston Manor.
